content:
## MARKET OVERVIEW

**1. What is the Current Market Regime?**
RISK-ON: low volatility (Vol: 15.6%) with limited participation (Breadth: 3/8 = mixed); environment favours risk assets but leadership narrow.

**2. Which sectors are leading?**
Retail & Food leading: BIMAS (1W: +12.12% | 1M: +16.47%) ABOVE TREND, MGROS (1W: +6.58% | 1M: +13.98%) ABOVE TREND, ULKER (1W: +5.44% | 1M: +5.53%) ABOVE TREND. Heavy Industry showing strength: ASELS (1W: +12.74% | 1M: +42.03%) ABOVE TREND and EREGL (1W: +0.08% | 1M: +2.36%) ABOVE TREND.

**3. Which sectors are lagging?**
Energy & Chemicals mixed-to-lagging: SASA (1W: -19.11% | 1M: -17.42%) BELOW TREND, SISE (1W: -2.63% | 1M: -2.20%) BELOW TREND. Banking under short-term pressure: HALKB (1W: -4.45% | 1M: +13.48%) CORRECTION, YKBNK (1W: -2.95% | 1M: +3.13%) CORRECTION. Technology & Telecom showing weakness: KONTR (1W: -3.89% | 1M: -24.44%) BELOW TREND.

## STOCK PERFORMANCE

**4. Top Performing Stocks?**
ASELS (1W: +12.74% | 1M: +42.03%) ABOVE TREND, BIMAS (1W: +12.12% | 1M: +16.47%) ABOVE TREND, TRALT (1W: +9.64% | 1M: +29.30%) ABOVE TREND, MGROS (1W: +6.58% | 1M: +13.98%) ABOVE TREND, ULKER (1W: +5.44% | 1M: +5.53%) ABOVE TREND.

**5. Worst Performing Stocks?**
SASA (1W: -19.11% | 1M: -17.42%) BELOW TREND, HEKTS (1W: -7.84% | 1M: -7.84%) BELOW TREND, VESTL (1W: -4.20% | 1M: -11.95%) BELOW TREND, KONTR (1W: -3.89% | 1M: -24.44%) BELOW TREND, HALKB (1W: -4.45% | 1M: +13.48%) CORRECTION.

**6. Momentum Stocks?**
ASELS (1W: +12.74% | 1M: +42.03%) ABOVE TREND, BIMAS (1W: +12.12% | 1M: +16.47%) ABOVE TREND, TRALT (1W: +9.64% | 1M: +29.30%) ABOVE TREND — strong short-term flows and clear 1W confirmation.

## SECTOR OUTLOOK

**7. Banking Sector Outlook?**
Banking mixed with profit-taking: AKBNK (1W: +0.13% | 1M: +7.12%) ABOVE TREND but GARAN (1W: -1.73% | 1M: +5.20%) CORRECTION, ISCTR (1W: -0.34% | 1M: +4.89%) CORRECTION, YKBNK (1W: -2.95% | 1M: +3.13%) CORRECTION — watch earnings and NIM commentary.

**8. Industrial Sector Outlook?**
Heavy Industry bifurcated: ASELS (1W: +12.74% | 1M: +42.03%) ABOVE TREND and FROTO (1W: +2.70% | 1M: +4.13%) ABOVE TREND lead, while VESTL (1W: -4.20% | 1M: -11.95%) BELOW TREND signals selective exposure.

**9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?**
Energy mixed — TUPRS (1W: +4.20% | 1M: +5.47%) ABOVE TREND and TRMET (1W: +4.30% | 1M: +20.22%) ABOVE TREND outperform, but SASA (1W: -19.11% | 1M: -17.42%) BELOW TREND and HEKTS (1W: -7.84% | 1M: -7.84%) BELOW TREND highlight event risk.

## PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

**10. Portfolio Recommendation?**
Risk-on stance: overweight Retail & Food and selective industrials (ASELS, FROTO, TOASO), overweight high-quality energy names with momentum (TRALT, TUPRS); trim weak cyclicals and avoid names with idiosyncratic selloffs (SASA, KONTR). Keep cash buffer for volatility spikes and use stops on recent runners.

## NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

**11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?**
ASELS (1W: +12.74% | 1M: +42.03%) ABOVE TREND for continuation or pullback, BIMAS (1W: +12.12% | 1M: +16.47%) ABOVE TREND for retail momentum, SASA (1W: -19.11% | 1M: -17.42%) BELOW TREND for downside follow-through, TRALT (1W: +9.64% | 1M: +29.30%) ABOVE TREND for energy breakout, HALKB (1W: -4.45% | 1M: +13.48%) CORRECTION for bank rotation.

**12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?**
Retail & Food for continued rotation and sales data sensitivity, Energy & Chemicals for commodity-driven moves and earnings, Banking for rate commentary and earnings circulation.

**13. Key Levels & Triggers?**
Watch XU100 momentum around recent intraday highs and short-term moving averages for continuation; catalysts include domestic CPI, CBRT commentary, large-cap earnings, and global risk sentiment/commodity price moves — breaches or holds of near-term support should drive rebalances.

## EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Low-volatility RISK-ON tape but narrow leadership: Retail & Food and select industrials/energy are driving returns while several names suffer idiosyncratic selloffs. Favor momentum in clear winners (ASELS, BIMAS, TRALT) and manage downside risk in weak, event-driven names (SASA, KONTR) while monitoring bank corrections.
